intro: Centaurea maris-nigri, commonly known as the Black Sea centaury, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Black Sea. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, thriving in maritime climates. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Centaurea maris-nigri is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
